Project.Brief history of your project and organi: NASA is an independent agency of the United States federal government responsible for developing and implementing the United States' civil space program and conducting aerospace and space science research.NASA advances our understanding of the Earth through its Earth Observation System[8] and advances solar science through its Solar Science Program[9]. NASA focuses on exploring all celestial bodies in the Solar System using advanced robotic spacecraft such as the New Horizons mission[10] and studying topics in astrophysics such as the Big Bang theory using its Large Orbiting Observatory Program and related programs[11]. NASA shares its research data with many organizations both within the United States and internationally. It is the world's largest government space agency.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The Medium Resolution Imaging Spectrometer (MERIS) is one of 10 sensors deployed in March of 2002 on board the polar-orbiting Envisat-1 environmental research satellite by the European Space Agency (ESA). The MERIS instrument is a moderate-resolution wide field-of-view push-broom imaging spectroradiometer capable of sensing in the 390 nm to 1040 nm spectral range. Being a programmable instrument, it had the unique capability of selectively adjusting the width and location of its 15 bands through ground command. The instrument has a 68.5-degree field of view and a swath width of 1150 meters, providing a global coverage every 3 days at 300 m resolution. The MERIS instrument was primarily designed for measuring ocean color, but its scope of objectives was broadened to serve atmospheric and terrestrial observations as well. Communication with the Envisat-1 satellite was lost suddenly on the 8th of April, 2012, just weeks after celebrating its 10th year in orbit. All attempts to re-establish contact were unsuccessful, and the end of the mission was declared on May 9th, 2012.
